summary: Background Severe Acute Respiratory Infections (SARI) is the leading global cause of morbidity and mortality from infectious diseases. since January 2009, a Sentinel Surveillance System for Severe Acute Respiratory Infections has been established based in a northern province of Vietnam. the aim of this program is to describe the epidemiology and identify the viral etiologies of SARI in a province of the north of Vietnam. this study has detected the presence of a parainfluenza 4 outbreak and of sporadic human fluC cases in 2009. the system is sensitive to identify pandemic influenza A/H1N1/09 community transmission.
